info.title: Adding nodes with crm cluster join

abstract.para: Add more nodes to the cluster with the crm cluster join script. The script only needs access to an existing cluster node and completes the basic setup on the current machine automatically. For more information, run the crm cluster join --help command.

topic.para: Perform this procedure on each additional node:

step.para: Log in to this node as the same user you set up the first node with.
If you set up the first node as &rootuser;, you can start the script with no additional parameters:
If you set up the first node as a sudo user, you must specify that user with the -c option:
The script checks whether &chrony; is running, opens the required firewall ports, and configures &csync;.
If you did not already specify the first node with -c, you are prompted for its IP address or host name.
If you did not already configure passwordless SSH access between the nodes, you are prompted for the password of the first node. If required, the script generates SSH keys for the new node.

The script proposes an IP address for ring0. This network interface must have the same device name as the interface used for ring0 on the first node. If it does not, enter the IP address of the correct network interface.

If the cluster has two &corosync; rings configured, the script prompts you for an IP address for ring1. This network interface must have the same device name as the interface used for ring1 on the first node.
The script asked for the admin@alice password again but the log doesn't say why... maybe csync?

topic.para: The script copies the cluster configuration from the first node, adjusts the timeout settings to consider the new node, and brings the new node online.
You can check the status of the cluster with the crm status command.
